name: toluene diisocyanate production | hydrochloric acid, without water, in 30% solution state | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/26059/documentation

This dataset represents the average production of 1 kg of toluene diisocyanate (TDI). At the same time, the formed hydrochloric acid is treated as a valuable by-product.;TDI (CAS: 584-84-9), an aromatic diisocyanate, is a white to pale yellow liquid with a pungent odour.TDI is mainly used in the industrial production of flexible polyurethane foams.;The industrial preparation of isocyanates is carried out with the reaction of an amine with phosgene in an aromatic solvent. In more detail, the production scheme for TDI can be breakdown into the following chemical reactions:;Nitration of toluene: C6H5CH3 + 2 HNO3 --> C7H6N2O4 + 2 H2O;Hydrogenation of dinitrotoluene: C7H6N2O4 + 6 H2 --> C7H10N2 + 4 H2O;;Toluene diamine phosgenation: C7H10N2 + 2 COCl2 --> C9H6N2O2 + 4 HCl;Hence, toluene is the primary raw material for the production of TDI, while dinitrotoluene can also be used as a starting material, i.e., bypassing the nitration step.;This dataset is based on industry data from three different TDI producers with three plants in two different European countries, which participated in the data collection.;References:;Christian Six, Frank Richter (2011): Isocyanates, organic, Ullmann's Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry, Wiley-VCH.;Heino Falcke, Simon Holbrook, Iain Clenahan,Alfredo Lopez Carretero, Teoman Sanalan,;Thomas Brinkmann, Joze Roth, Benoit Zerger; Serge Roudier, Luis Delgado Sancho (2017): Best Available Techniques (BAT) Reference Document for the Production of large Volume Organic Chemicals;2021, ISOPA , Eco-profile of toluene diisocyanate (TDI) and methylene diphenyl diisocyanate (MDI) , 3 - SeparatePublication;G. Margaret Wells, “Handbook of Petrochemicals and Processes”, 2nd edition, Ashgate, 1999;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:]

The activity starts when the raw materials enter the process.

This activity ends once  the products, i.e., 1 kg of toluene diisocyanate and 0.86 kg of hydrochloric acid, are at the production site gate. Materials entering the process are included as well as energy uses, infrastructure and emissions.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2013:Manufacture of plastics and synthetic rubber in primary forms

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data collection for production was collected as 12-month averages representing the year 2018. The inventory creation and calculation stage was concluded in 2020, while the technology is not expected to change until 2026.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Representative 100% of European (EU-28) production of toluene diisocyanate.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This inventory represents the average production of toluene diisocyanate, provided as a generic dataset in which TDI production covers both (1) toluene and (2) dinitrotoluene as raw materials.;In more detail, the chemical processes involved in the TDI production are described below.;First, toluene, as the primary raw material for the industrial manufacturing of TDI, undergoes catalytic nitration, yielding approximately an 80:20 mixture of 2,4- and 2,6-dinitrotoluene (DNT) isomers. Hence, plants may start the production of TDI with either toluene or the respective mixture of DNT isomers. ;Nitration of toluene: C6H5CH3 + 2 HNO3 --> C7H6N2O4 + 2 H2O;A hydrogenation step follows, where the DNT mixture is converted to diaminotoluene (TDA) isomers.;Hydrogenation of dinitrotoluene: C7H6N2O4 + 6 H2 --> C7H10N2 + 4 H2O;;The corresponding TDA mixture is subsequently treated with phosgene to produce a TDI isomer mixture in solution, along with HCl byproduct.;Toluene diamine phosgenation: C7H10N2 + 2 COCl2 --> C9H6N2O2 + 4 HCl;In absence of phosgene in the form of a raw material, this intermediate is produced on-side from carbon monoxide and chlorine.;Phosgene production: CO + Cl2 -->  COCl2;The solution is then purified via distillation, in which the 80:20 TDI isomer composition is maintained. Finally, a fractionation step is carried out, which yields a stream with 100% 2,4-TDI and another stream with a 65:35 mixture of 2,4- and 2,6-TDI isomers.;References:;2021, ISOPA , Eco-profile of toluene diisocyanate (TDI) and methylene diphenyl diisocyanate (MDI) , 3 - SeparatePublication
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The catalyst and stabilizer use, with a representation on dry mass input lower than 0.01%, was cut-off. Furthermore, an exchange representing unreacted raw materials that are recycled to the process after treatment, with a representation of 3.3% on dry mass output, was cut-off.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
Industry data, representative 100 % of European (EU-28) production capacity, based on production volumes in 2018.

The industrial data used originate from three different TDI producers, with three plant, in two different European countries.

exchanges.description: Valuable byproduct of the production technology.

exchanges.description:
Calculated based on literature data published by the industry. For this activity, no information was readily available concerning infrastructure and land-use. Therefore, the infrastructure is estimated based on data from two chemical factories, the BASF site of Ludwigshafen and the chemical factory in Gendorf (which are both located in Germany), which produce a wide range of chemical substances. Based on this data, the following assumptions are made: the built area amounts to about 4.2 ha, the plant has an average output of 50'000 t/a and a lifespan of fifty years. The estimated infrastructure amount is therefore 4.00 E-10 units per kg of produced chemical.

References:
Althaus H.-J., Chudacoff M., Hischier R., Jungbluth N., Osses M. and Primas A. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Chemicals. ecoinvent report No. 8, v2.0. EMPA Dübendorf, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH.
Gendorf (2000) Umwelterklärung 2000, Werk Gendorf. Werk Gendorf, Burgkirchen.;activityLink introduced to establish a direct link to the corresponding regional supply of this product
